title: Steal Away

author.name: Traditional
author.bio: This traditional African-American spiritual, believed to have been composed by Wallace Willis, conveys a deep yearning for freedom and an eternal home, expressing the hope and faith of the enslaved African-Americans.

lyrics:
Steal away, steal away,
Steal away to Jesus,
Steal away, steal away home;
I ain't got long to stay here.

My Lord calls me,
He calls me by the thunder
The trumpet sounds
Within my soul,
I ain't got long to stay here.

Green trees are bending,
Poor sinner stands a trembling,
The trumpet sounds within my soul
I ain't got long to stay here.

Tomb-stones are bursting,
Poor sinner stands a trembling,
The trumpet sounds within my soul,
I ain't got long to stay here.

My Lord calls me,
He calls me by the lightning,
The trumpet sounds within my soul,
I ain't got long to stay here.
